snippet: The plan calls for the C.I.A. to supply only small arms, and only to a limited segment of the opposition; the actual numbers are unclear.
abstract: Obama administration's plan to provide aid to Syrian rebels is far more limited than had been indicated in public comments, with officials saying it will take months to have any impact on battlefield; plan calls for Central Intelligence Agency to supply only small arms to limited segment of opposition, and training program has not yet even begun, partly due to Congressional objections.

byline.original: By MARK MAZZETTI, ERIC SCHMITT and ERIN BANCO

lead_paragraph: The plan calls for the C.I.A. to supply only small arms, and only to a limited segment of the opposition; the actual numbers are unclear.

headline.main: No Quick Impact in U.S. Arms Plan for Syria Rebels
headline.print_headline: No Quick Impact in U.S. Arms Plan for Syria Rebels
